results.title: Dirt [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Trace Fraim, Michael Covert, Kirk Hassig, Trudi Callon and Canned Pictures
results.brief_description: Two daft Texan brothers, Scooter and Junior, are left bereft and domestically helpless when their dear old Ma dies. They hatch a plan to get a woman to replace her, searching strip bars, and even approaching a prostitute to fulfil the role. When these attempts fail they kidnap DeDe (Tara Chocol), who, due to the sadistic nature of her marriage, decides to stay with them. After DeDe’s husband, a Texas Ranger, burns their house down, the brothers rob banks to support the burgeoning family. Junior, who has emotional problems, falls for DeDe whilst Scooter forms an attraction to a bank teller, Margaret, at a local branch they frequent. “Dirt” is a black comedy and farce that apes the style and energy of a Coen brothers’ film (in particular Raising Arizona) but screenwriter, director and star Michael Covert fails to achieve the same distinctly outlandish tone. Despite some slyly inspired moments, and witty one-liners, Covert ultimately opts for conventional narrative outcomes over his subversive intentions. The film trots out a slew of familiar Texan movie cliches (bigoted and corrupt police, violent husbands, dim-witted simple folk) whilst amid all the darkly themed humour, it attempts to make some salient points about the futility of male violence. Also stars Tracy Fraim, Patrick Warburton and Olivia Rosewood.

results.title: Directors of the future
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A ‘mokumentary’ following the trials and tribulations of future ‘Star Director’ Izabella Dazs’ career. We begin the film as she is formulating an idea for her film and we finish by seeing her end product, “Les pommes du mal”.

group_siblings.title: Attack of the strange insects from Uranus

results.title: Director's cut
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Stephanie Moore
results.brief_description: Stephanie reflects on her time as director of Positive Women, a support and advocacy organisation for women with HIV. She is inspired by the courage of the women who must come to terms with a disease that can kill them or significantly reduce their quality of life.

results.title: Directing a play
results.creator_credit: Betty Edmonds, Robert Edmonds and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Rehearsals of Louise Dale Spoor’s adaptation of Mark Twain’s “Tom Sawyer” are used to illustrate the work of the director in the performance of a stage play. Shows the first reading of the play by cast and director followed by a discussion of the play, its actions and characters; preliminary work on the stage floor, rehearsals without props; recording of action times and stage movements; the first dress rehearsal.

results.title: Directing a film: Ionesco's 'The New tenant'
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: To better acquaint students with the role of the director in motion picture production, this film takes them behind the scenes both before and during the filming of Eugene Ionesco’s play “The New Tenant”. Scenes from the early stages of planning and preparation are intercut with scenes from the completed film version of the play to enable students to better understand how the director’s initial thoughts and ideas are realized.

results.title: Dipping sheep
results.brief_description: Stresses the importance, at dipping time, of making a clean muster and dipping all sheep on the property. The importance of keeping sheep in the bath for a sufficient length of time and the necessity of following the manufacturer’s instructions when mixing the dip are also stressed. Various types of spray plants and plunge dips are shown.

results.title: Diplomacy
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The history of the diplomat’s functions and skills. The commentary includes quotations from figures as contrasted as Demosthenes, Machiavelli, and President Kennedy. Shows how the modern career diplomat exercises techniques developed over centuries, but today is supported by the resources of modern technology. He must have qualities of patience, integrity and a strong sense of national purpose. Narrated by Alastair Duncan.

results.title: Dionne quintuplets
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, Paul Wright, Peter Katadotis, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Back in 1934, Elzire Dionne delivered five identical girls. This documentary follows Cecile, Emilie, Marie, Yvonne and Annette through twenty one years of strange upbringing. When the girls were just infants, the premier of Ontario issued a court order removing them from their parent’s care. Cut off from the world and their family, over-publicised, viewed twice daily in a special viewing compound, they grew up as prize exhibits. Director Donald Brittain uses newsreel footage, home movie sequences and interviews to depict a historic event that became a tragic exploitation of a family.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Brittain, Paul Wright, Peter Katadotis, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Dinosaurs: the terrible lizards
results.creator_credit: Wah Chang and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description: Uses special effects and models to recreate the age of the dinosaurs. Gives an overview of what they looked like, what they ate, and how they lived and died. Suitable for lower and upper primary levels.
